comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Another beauty NLI, a record of a time as well as of a railway!  The schoolboy in uniform with the skullcap and bag on his back, the lad in the blazer striking a pose with his braces showing, the bellows cameras neatly folded away on the two gentlemen on the right, just wonderful.  As regards the ladies?  They were at home doing what they should do--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- planning the feminist revolution!!!!!

It is gorgeous, isn't it? And everyone looks so delighted to be there...

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/47290943@N03] Nah! trains and all that, it's a boy's thing and guilty as charged.

We should be so grateful for the IRRS that they have preserved so much.

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: It's the old York Rd station, which was closed in the 1980s. The site is now a train depot, but there is nowadays an adjacent York Gate station. I'll show this photo to some people who might know the individuals, some I know a bit myself!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/finnyus/] Hello and thanks for adding the note. I think you're dead right about Joe St. Leger from Cork. I found this photo in a great set dedicated to Joe St. Leger, and I certainly think it's the same gentleman...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: In response to PaganTree, the train is diesel railcar No.4, built by the Northern Counties Commitee company at York Rd works in 1938, it survived until 1969 when it was destroyed by vandals! The IRRS party travelled by this special train to Cookstown Jct and Kilrea before returning to Belfast and back home to Dublin.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/flyingsnail] Thank you for fielding that question! I always have to run away in the face of direct technical train questions :)
